  2. 分享交流

    • 与他人分享经验

  3. 个人成长

The bar chart illustrates the changes in China’s express delivery volume from 2018 to 2020, comparing the total volume and rural volume separately. Over the three-year period, the total express delivery volume saw a significant increase, rising from 51 billion pieces in 2018 to 83 billion pieces in 2020. Similarly, the rural express delivery volume also experienced growth, increasing from 12 billion pieces in 2018 to 30 billion pieces in 2020.

These trends suggest a growing reliance on e-commerce and online shopping across China, particularly in rural areas. The expansion of logistics infrastructure and improved accessibility to online services likely contributed to this rise. Moreover, the increasing popularity of online platforms may have encouraged more people to purchase goods remotely, further driving up the demand for express delivery services.

In summary, the chart demonstrates a clear upward trajectory in both total and rural express delivery volumes in China from 2018 to 2020, reflecting broader shifts towards digital commerce and enhanced connectivity within the country.

The line graph presents the health literacy rate of Chinese residents from 2012 to 2021. In about a decade, there has been a steady increase in the percentage of individuals with adequate health knowledge and skills. Starting at 8.80% in 2012, the rate climbed gradually each year, reaching 25.40% by 2021. This upward trajectory suggests a positive trend in public health awareness and education efforts across the country during this period.

We can/may attribute this phenomenon to the following aspects.(Several factors may account for these/this change).To begin with, government implementation of more effective [relevant policies] has contributed to the rise in [specific indicator].What’s more,greater availability of [type of information] through [specific channels such as digital media, the internet, etc.] has made it easier for people to obtain relevant information. Additionally,continuous efforts by government and social organizations to conduct [specific activities such as health education, disease prevention, etc.] have improved public awareness and skills.

This trend highlights the importance of continued investment in specific areas such as health education and public health to maintain and accelerate progress in these fields. To sum up, we can predict that this trend will continue in the future.

评论

Impact of Technological Advancements: Advancements in mobile communication technology have significantly contributed to the growth of mobile phone users worldwide. Developing countries have benefited from reduced costs and technology diffusion, leading to rapid user growth.

Economic Development Factors: Differences in economic development may account for variations in subscription numbers across countries and regions. While developed countries experienced slower growth, their larger base ensured that the absolute numbers remained high.

Market Saturation Levels: Developing countries have substantial market potential and have not yet reached saturation, resulting in rapid growth. In contrast, markets in developed countries are nearing saturation, leaving limited room for new growth.

Policy Support and Infrastructure Investment: Government support and investment in infrastructure are crucial for the development of mobile communications. Developing countries have improved network coverage and service quality through government subsidies and international cooperation.

Sociocultural Factors: Sociocultural changes have influenced the acceptance and demand for mobile communication. With the advancement of globalization and informatization, mobile communication has become an indispensable part of daily life.

  1. 技术进步的影响：
    • 移动通信技术的进步极大地促进了全球范围内移动电话用户的增长。
    • 发展中国家受益于成本降低和技术扩散，从而实现了快速的用户增长。
  2. 经济发展因素：
    • 经济发展的差异可能导致不同国家和地区之间的订阅数差异。
    • 发达国家虽然增长缓慢，但其基数较大，因此绝对值仍然很高。
  3. 市场饱和程度：
    • 发展中国家市场的潜力巨大，尚未达到饱和状态，因此增长迅速。
    • 相反，发达国家市场接近饱和，新增长空间有限。
  4. 政策支持与基础设施建设：
    • 政府的支持和基础设施的投资对于移动通信的发展至关重要。
    • 发展中国家通过政府补贴和国际合作提高了网络覆盖范围和服务质量。
  5. 社会文化因素：
    • 社会文化的变迁影响了人们对移动通信的接受程度和需求。
    • 随着全球化和信息化的推进，移动通信成为日常生活中不可或缺的一部分。

经济，技术，政策，文化

  1. 经济 (Economy)

    • 词汇：Economy, Economic
    • 常用表达：
      • The Chinese economy has shown strong growth over the past decade.
      • Economic policies have a significant impact on market trends.
      • The global economy is increasingly interconnected.

  2. 技术 (Technology)

    • 词汇：Technology, Technological
    • 常用表达：
      • Advances in technology have revolutionized many industries.
      • Technological innovation is driving economic development.
      • The rapid pace of technological change presents both opportunities and challenges.

  3. 政策 (Policy)

    • 词汇：Policy, Policies
    • 常用表达：
      • Government policies play a crucial role in shaping the business environment.
      • Environmental policies aim to reduce pollution and promote sustainability.
      • Economic policies are designed to stimulate growth and stability.

  4. 文化 (Culture)

    • 词汇：Culture, Cultural
    • 常用表达：
      • Chinese culture has a rich history and diverse traditions.
      • Cultural exchange promotes mutual understanding between different countries.
      • The influence of popular culture can be seen in various aspects of daily life.

“The development of the Chinese economy over the past decade has been significantly influenced by advancements in technology, supportive government policies, and the preservation of cultural heritage. Technological innovation has driven productivity and competitiveness, while policies aimed at fostering entrepreneurship and sustainability have created a favorable business environment. Additionally, the rich and diverse Chinese culture continues to play an important role in shaping social values and consumer behavior.”

The bar chart shows the changes in the Air Quality Index (AQI) in four big Chinese cities—Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, and Shenzhen—from 2010 to 2020. This chart helps us understand how the air quality has changed in these cities over the years.

In Beijing, the AQI went down a lot, from 120 in 2010 to 80 in 2020. This big drop means the air quality got much better, probably because of strong environmental rules and actions taken by the government. Shanghai also saw a similar change, with its AQI going down from 110 to 75, showing that the city is working hard to reduce pollution.On the other hand, Guangzhou’s AQI stayed almost the same, between 90 and 100. This means the air quality in Guangzhou didn’t change much, even though the city is trying to keep it steady. In Shenzhen, the AQI went up a little, from 70 to 85. This small increase is worrying and shows that the air quality is getting worse, which needs attention.

Overall, the chart tells us that Beijing and Shanghai have done a good job in improving air quality, thanks to their strong environmental policies. However, Guangzhou’s air quality didn’t change much, and Shenzhen’s got worse. These results show that different cities need different plans to deal with pollution and keep the environment clean.

两个句子中使用 “when” 的情况不同，主要是因为它们所描述的关系和动作的性质不同。让我们来分析一下这两个句子：

  1. 关于顾客选择餐厅的因素：

    • “The pie chart illustrates the different factors that customers in a certain city considered when choosing a restaurant in 2017.”
    • 在这个句子中，”when” 用来连接两个事件：顾客考虑某些因素（the different factors that customers considered）和他们选择餐厅的动作（choosing a restaurant）。这里 “when” 表示的是时间点或时间段，即在顾客做选择的那个时刻，他们在考虑这些因素。

  2. 关于学生使用手机阅读的目的：

    • “The pie chart illustrates the different purposes for which students at a certain university used their phones for reading in 2017.”
    • 在这个句子中，”for which” 是用来引导定语从句，修饰 “purposes”。这里的重点是学生使用手机阅读的具体目的，而不是在特定的时间点上发生的动作。因此，不需要用 “when” 来表示时间关系。”in 2017” 则是用来限定这一行为发生的时间范围，但不是为了表示某个具体的选择时刻。

总结来说，第一个句子中的 “when” 强调了在做出选择时考虑的因素，而第二个句子中的 “for which” 更关注于行为的目的。如果在第二个句子中使用 “when”，则可能会改变句子的意思，暗示学生是在特定的时间点决定使用手机阅读，这并不是句子想要传达的主要信息。

使用 “for which”

  • 先行词是“目的”或“原因”：
    • “The reason for which we exercise is to stay healthy.”
    • “The purpose for which we exercise is to improve our fitness.”

使用 “that”

  • 先行词是“人”或“物”：
    • “The book that I read last night was very interesting.”
    • “The person that I met at the party was very friendly.”
  • 先行词是“方式”或“方法”：
    • “The method that we use to solve the problem is efficient.”
    • “The way that we organize our tasks is crucial.”

使用 “which”

  • 先行词是“物”：
    • “The car which I bought last year is very reliable.”
    • “The house which we live in is quite spacious.”

使用 “in which”

  • 先行词是“方式”或“方法”：
    • “The way in which we solve problems is important.”
    • “The method in which we conduct our experiments is crucial.”

使用 “that which”

  • 先行词是“物”或“概念”：
    • “That which is most important is often overlooked.”
    • “That which we seek is often hidden.”

为什么 “By” 和 “That” 不能互换

  • 语法功能不同：”By” 是介词，通常跟在动词后面，表示方式、手段、代理等；而 “that” 是连词或关系代词，用于引导从句或指代事物。
  • 语义不同：”By” 侧重于描述动作的方式、时间和地点，而 “that” 用于连接句子部分或指代特定的事物。
  • 句子结构不同：”By” 通常出现在句中或句尾，作为介词短语的一部分；而 “that” 通常出现在句中，引导从句或作为指示代词。

4. 举例说明

  • 正确用法：

    • Using “by”:

      The project was completed by the team.

      • Explanation: “by” 表示项目的完成者是团队。

    • Using “that”:

      The project that was completed by the team was highly successful.

      • Explanation: “that” 引导定语从句，修饰 “project”，指明被团队完成的那个项目。

  • 错误替换：

    • Incorrect: The project was completed that the team.
      • Explanation: 这里的 “that” 不能替代 “by”，因为 “that” 不能表示代理或执行者。
    • Incorrect: The project by was completed by the team.
      • Explanation: 这里的 “by” 不能替代 “that”，因为 “by” 不能引导定语从句。
